TestCase.Title: Test case EID_CLIENT_C3_02
TestCase.Purpose: Positive test that checks the ability of the eID-Client to built a suitable certificate chain for Terminal Authentication if the ICC contains an old trust point and the eID-Server sends a minimal chain to pass Pre-Verification
TestCase.Precondition: A single basic card reader is connected to the eID-Client system.
A single active eID-Card is connected to the card reader.
The eID-Card has the following trust point(s): [CERT_CV_CVCA_4_c] from [CERT_SET_4].
The Trust store of the eID-Client is configured as stated in the ICS.
The eID-Client has been activated and the communication channels TLS-1, TLS-1-2 and TLS-2 have been established.
The eService uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_ESERVICE_4_A] from [CERT_SET_4].
The eID-Server uses the TLS server certificate [CERT_TLS_EIDSERVER_4_A] from [CERT_SET_4].
The eService has sent a default TC Token to the eID-Client.
The eID-Client and the eID-Server have established PAOS communication.
b>r. The case r>=b is already covered by EID_CLIENT_C2_2_01.

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC1InputType" contains the parameters "Certificate" and "CertificateDescription".
The certificate chain from [CERT_SET_4] is sent in given order: [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A], [CERT_CV_DV_4_A], [CERT_CV_LINK_4_s-1], ... , [CERT_CV_LINK_4_b].

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client displays EAC data received from the eID-Server before the user enters his PIN.

Command.Text: Do not change CertificateHolderAuthorizationTemplate and enter the correct PIN of the eID-Card.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client responds with the message "DIDAuthenticateResponse_EAC1OutputType".
The message contains at least the following elements: "Result", "CertificationAuthorityReference", "EFCardAccess", "IDPICC" and "Challenge".
The element "Result" contains exactly one element "ResultMajor" which equals /resultmajor#ok.
The element "EFCardAccess" matches the card file EF.CardAccess.
The element "CertificationAuthorityReference" contains a reference to the certificate [CERT_CV_CVCA_4_r].

Command.Text: The eID-Server generates a fresh key pair for Chip Authentication using valid domain parameters, creates a valid signature of the received challenge using [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A] and invokes "DIDAuthenticate_EAC2InputType".

TestStep.Description: The message "DIDAuthenticate_EAC2InputType" contains the parameters "Certificate", "EphemeralPublicKey" and "Signature".
The element "Certificate" contains the required link certificates [CERT_CV_LINK_4_b-1], ... , [CERT_CV_LINK_4_r].
The element "EphemeralPublicKey" contains the generated public key for Chip Authentication.
The element "Signature" contains the calculated signature for Terminal Authentication.

ExpectedResult.Text: The eID-Client performs Terminal Authentication and sends the following certificate chain to the eID-Card: [CERT_CV_LINK_4_r], ... , [CERT_CV_LINK_4_s-1], [CERT_CV_DV_4_A], [CERT_CV_TERM_4_A].
